## Welcome | Setting Up

Before getting started there are a few things you'll need in order to be successful in the course

- A recent version of [R](https://cran.r-project.org/)

I am currently using version 3.4.0 on Ubuntu

- A recent version of [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

I am currently using version 1.0.143

- A web browser like Firefox (any OS), Chrome (any OS) or Microsoft Edge (Windows 10)

- (Optional) StackExchange [Cross Validated](https://stats.stackexchange.com/) account

Feel free to ask lookup, ask and answer questions on Cross Validated


## Optional References

No textbook is necessary to follow with the course!

1. For Monte Carlo methods: [Introducing Monte Carlo Methods with R](https://www.amazon.com/Introducing-Monte-Carlo-Methods-Use/dp/1441915753)
  - Read reviews before making any purchases!
  
2. For statistics and probability review: [Introduction to Probability Models, Tenth Edition](https://www.amazon.com/Introduction-Probability-Models-Tenth-Sheldon/dp/0123756863/ref=sr_1_9?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1502653034&sr=1-9)

The course follows the layout of work by Christian Robert & George Casella.
